column8:
Edge of Space was left abruptly unfinished and abandoned, a convoluted process of trying too hard to be Not Terraria that it couldn't find much identity of its own besides a mess few wanted to play.  It looks great, was going a bit slow, but then placeholders became features.

Yet another developer and development who have tried their best to make "1.0" meaningless, and in this case it wasn't in any good way.

column8:
To avoid my review going on and on with pointless details of boredom and issues I'll put it simple instead.

The game is similar to Terraria and Starbound due to its 2D perspective and resource gathering mechanics however it lacks that one certain charm that the two have that allows players to keep coming back and playing more.

Sadly and simply put: I cannot give a fair review of this game

EDIT: Abandonware, stay far away. I really wanted this to turn out different, when I wrote this review I was a lot younger and honestly I hardly understood the game. But nothings changed, Terraria is now leagues ahead of this game and Starbound (while being abandoned it self) is propped up by its modding community. This game doesn't have anything above either of those other two, play those instead.

column9: If you're tired of Terraria and Starbound and want a similar game, this is the one for you. One of the downsides I found is that there aren't many instructions on how to get items or what weapons do. Although there's a small tutorial, there's no way to learn how a weapon works without spending items and crafting it. Despite this, the game seems to have a wide variety of things to do. If you buy it on sale, it's worth it.

It doesn't compare to Terraria... Or a wet potato for that matter either. 

The crafting system is less rewarding than that of Terraria. Somehow they managed to add complexity, but removed depth. I wanted to like this game so badly. I tried. After 5 minutes I felt like it "bleh," but I'll give it a chance. Its still "bleh" even 5+ hours in. 

I would rather eat soggy french fries than play this game anymore. There are more than enough other games worth playing.

column8:
Tags: Sidescroll - Survival & Questing
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: This is No man's Sky. The sidescrolling version without interplanetary flying. Play Starbound and Terraria instead.

Review: Unlike terraria you do not constantly get molested by a host of vaguely chtulu or haloween themed monsters. There is a fake ecosystem of frogs and crabs and stuff that just happens to live about the planet's surface. The game hints that your goal is to exterminate all life on the surface for some reason. Occasionally I would get an event telling me to go mine out a local creature's nest. Mining also seemed to give experience on a per-tile mined basis and the game featured setting up a workbench and grinding at upgrades. I thought the visual presentation was not all that bad. The animations, color palettes and sprite quality seemed alright. The procedural generation was messed up, created my homebase on at tiny island floating in the heavens meaning to start the game I had to first dive down towards the surface. Jetpack seemed to work when it wants to, sometimes holding a charge no problem and sometimes refusing to lift me up whatsoever. Interactivity with environment felt very limited. Monsters were not outright attacking me, and the mining laser would refuse to deconstruct trees, as well as animals. The audio was extremely sparse with only a few sound effects here and there. The intro cutscene was obviously done with cost cutting measures in mind but it was done elegantly enough that I could give it a pass. Some of the terrain tiles seemed mismatched with grass tiles popping out of the surface unevenly for no reason next to regular dirt tiles for example. This game does not feel finished. It feels like it was rushed out of early access with bare minimum for core features and procedural generation to pick up the slack.
column9:

column8: Kurzezusammenfassung? ok, schlechte steuerung, schlechte physiks, schlechte grafik, schechtes Tutorial (damit ist nicht Fineon gemeint der is cool ^^), man kennt sich kaum aus wegen Tutorial und so kaum vorhanden, die einleitung hab ich kaum kapiert (kÃ¶nnte natÃ¼rlich auch an mir liegen) da fÃ¤nd ichs besser keine einleitung zu haben..... aber ja gut, komisches Terrain und sehr klein und nervig aufgebaut (kÃ¶nnte aber auch zufall gewesen sein), nun ja aber die guten dinge darf man nicht vergessen oder zumindest die nicht misserablen eigenschaften. Da wÃ¤re Fineon der Guide fisch (tschuldige Haifisch aber FISCH!) find ich ganz nett, das Levelsystem also die Tech stufenentwicklung find ich sehr geil, und die charakter anpassung ist auch cool generell gefallen mir die Kreaturen und Lebewesen besser als die restliche Grafik. aber um ehrlich zu sein und zum schluss zukommen leider ein schlechtes spiel auch wenn die guten sachen sehr cool sind (techsystem) ist es einfach fÃ¼r mich unspielbar und da geh ich lieber zu Starbound. falls ihr spaÃŸ dran findet is gut aber nix fÃ¼r mich. wenns verbessert werden wÃ¼rde kÃ¶nnte das richtig geil sein.
column9: Short summary? OK, bad controls, bad physics, bad graphics, terrible tutorial (I don't mean Fineon, he's cool ^^), you hardly know your way around because of the barely existent tutorial and such, I hardly understood the introduction (that could of course be my fault) I think it would be better not to have an introduction..... but yeah, weird terrain and very small and annoyingly laid out (but that could also have been a coincidence), well, but you shouldn't forget the good things, or at least the not-bad features. There's Fineon the guide fish (sorry, shark, but FISH!) I think is quite nice, the level system, i.e. the tech level development, I think is really cool, and the character customization is cool too. In general, I like the creatures and living beings better than the rest of the graphics. But to be honest, and to conclude, this is unfortunately a bad game. Even though the good stuff is very cool (tech system), it's simply unplayable for me, and I'd rather go with Starbound. If you enjoy it, it's fine, but it's not for me. If it were improved, it could be really cool.

column8:
Bought for like Â£3, and that value shows.

Usability is a nightmare. 

Controls are not that intuitive, if. you're going to make a sandbox genre game that copies elements from successful ones - maybe also copy control schemes that are prove to work.

The UI is clunky and dated for a game that was released in 2015.

Loading time on first launch is way too long for a game that has a very distinct pixel art style - plenty of other games in the same genre manage to have relatively swift loading times.

It doesn't seem like a whole lot of indepth research was put into the groundwork of this game at all, it looked like it was going to have a lot of depth and character, but it feels very shallow.

column8:
Oh boy...

I had confidence in this game.  A friend as pond I discovered it when browsing Steam and when we saw it had "Terraria" content in it (even to the point of Terraria having a window message saying "Also try Edge of Space"), and we were such big fans of that, we just had to get it.  I bought this game in a "buy one get one free" deal so we could do co-op together.  I tried to play this game I really tried, but there's just not enough redeeming qualities I could find to make this review positive.

First, I'd like to say I have been playing in early access rather than the full release, as I got bored during early access and couldn't even bring myself to boot it up again.  This game expects far too much from it's players.  You're practically playing a sandbox game stuck in hard mode, and forced to play with horrible controls.  There are way too many sub-menus to navigate, and the crafting system is so weird and doesn't make enough sense.

In games like this (i.e. Minecraft, Terraria, Starbound), we as players tend to remember the best crafting recipes, but Edge of Space takes the fun of that away and makes things over-complicated by having blocks fall into particular groups and letting you do the rest from there.

Every aspect of what makes this a "sandbox" game is terrible.  Placing blocks isn't satisfying as the one planet you're stuck on only offers you so many that you really might as well go to dirt to construct a "house" to stay the night.  Mining is extremely boring, and not engaging in the slightest.  I don't know if it was just me, but all ores in the game (which look far too identical to regular stone) took far too long to mine, and the steam icons that show your progress on obtaining the ore really don't change a lot so you'll be wondering how long it'll take to get anything from a vein.  Combat is also dumb.  Right when they drop you into this game, you have limited respawns, granted you can collect more.  But fighting in this game is just boring, it has no depth to it like in Terraria or Starbound and the enemies deal far too much damage that you basically fire at them from a distance the entire fight.  Not to mention these creeps spawn in caves and will interrupt your mining ALL THE TIME!

After coming back to this game and seeing the negative reviews it's getting and seeing how the Devs apparently abandoned it entirely, I'm honestly just disappointed.  There WAS hope for Edge of Space at one point, but when you release your game completely and it has a bunch of the bugs that already existed in EA, then you're basically just making an incomplete game to get a quick buck.

Don't buy this game.  If you want a thrilling space-themed sandbox game buy Starbound.  You'll get a lot more enjoyment out of it than whatever you can call this.

(Oh and co-op doesn't work at all.  You'll give up when you reach a point where you keep disconnecting from your friend's server.)

column8:
tl;dr: if you're looking for "Terraria in space", buy Starbound. Don't waste 88 hours of your life like I did trying to find the game in this steaming pile of crap.

It's like Starbound or Terraria! Except without any of the diversity or fun discoveries that make Starbound and Terraria great.

Now including:
-Terrible devs that clearly abandoned ship years ago
-Ugly, generic spritework that lacks any of the rough-cut charisma that other pixel art games usually have
-Weapons that all feel the same
-Confusing progression
-Very plain biomes that look the same no matter where you go (The lower biomes aren't any better. They're basically the same thing in a different color.)
-Indescipherable UI (with no map, by the way.)
-Stupid glitches abound

The only credit I can give it is that it's a program that exists and can be run by my computer.
1/10.

column8:
Wow that game Isn't that bad. why very negative?
Work fine for me and don't look unfinish. even after 41hr. but didn't reach the end part.
(maybe that game been abandonned but for me it is in a fine state)
If it broken better ask for a refund last update 16 dec 2015 (last new 29 april 2016)

Didn't seem broken but  the gameplay a little weird.
you build your house and crafting tool
but in term of design it kinda bad i don't feel the decoration are nice.

the skill research not great and a little annoying you need exp for it.
The crafting system work well but a little a mess with too much stuff.

The planet seem like a sky islands with falling pit
 it really hard get to the bottom without dying like a comet need a good jet pack and caution,
and you need radiation protection,

The jetpack a little overabuse you will always fight the gravity avoid big fail.
Sudden brake not work like most the game you only slow down gradualy until you can fly up.
(that really make sense and add a challenge.)
   
THe boss fight kinda very long and some move seem unavoidable and hit very hard,

I really have fun and it challenging but a few thing can be annoying.
I like how the crafting can use many kind of simillar material instead a specific one.


Starbound and terraria better.
but if you looking for a nice challenge that a good alternative it quite unique.

column8:
Gameworld consists of giant floating chunks of dirt and if you go mining through them you fall six miles onto a pile of crabs that instantly kill you.

The U.I. is horribly setup.

The art in-game is quite ugly to me, and building is annoying and unsatisfying.

NPCs in game are "unique" but they are so outlandish for no reason in such a ugly game the come across as if a five year old came up with them. If I remember correctly, the guide is a robo shark with miniture people for teeth and whenever you talk to it, a cringy audio cue plays that sounds like someone is flossing inside your ear drum.

Reading other reviews for this game I see a lot of let down people and broken end game goals I cannot reach without dying from boredom or frustration due to the interface.

column8:
Updated for 2019

I'm updating this to save people from wasting their money on this product. 

It was never completed yet the dev's released it anyways saying it was complete. It's full of bugs, little content but the most disgraceful and disgusting thing is the dev's disappeared for YEARS without saying a word. They come back giving a half baked excuse on why they haven't made any updates and tried using it to gain sympathy and understanding on why they never finished their game. What they did is a disgrace and they should be ashamed because within that time frame of silence, they tried kick starting another game which luckily failed. 

AVOID THIS GAME AND ALL GAMES RELATED TO THIS DEV at all cost.

column8:
I've had this game in my library for a while.  I bought it back when I was looking for a Terraria-esque game, and either Starbound wasn't out yet, or I hadn't discovered it.

It seemed VERY promising at first.  So, I decided to put it on hold and come back once a few updates had been released for it.  Unfortunately, by the time I did come back...the developers had pretty much abandoned the game.

Now, that's not the only problem - the other problem is that you gather resources too slowly; now, you could make that argument about Terraria or Starbound, but there's a difference: in those game, it's it was slow at first because you needed to update your tools; and over time, you upgraded your tools, reducing the time it takes to gather resources.  Not to mention that they gave you other stuff to do in the meantime, like quests, boss battles, or exploring dungeons.  Here, it's because the things you need to upgrade are too hard to find.  It takes WAY too long to make something like a house - in Terraria, you can have a simple house up by nightfall; in Starbound, it's a bit longer if you decide to build a base on a planet instead of your ship, but it's still completable in a reasonable amount of time; in this game? ...You'll be lucky if you're even done with a quarter of the house by that time.

Even then, the other problem is that...well, once you get past the tutorial, it's empty.  There's nothing obvious for you to do.  This is because of the lack of an NPC to give you hints like in Terraria or a quest system like in Stardew Valley.  At that point, it feels like a 2D Version of No Man's Sky, minus the ability to go to other planets (to be fair though, at least this game doesn't cost nearly as much as NMS).

It's a pity that this game is now abandonware, since it does have some good ideas - I like the power system idea, since it makes you plan out your base; also, the research system is a good idea in theory (although in execution, it fails).

If the developers ever decide to pick this game back up and start updating it again, I might give it a second shot, but at the moment, I cannot recommend this game.

If you're contemplating buying this game, I would suggest passing on it and instead picking up Terraria, which does the idea of a 2d Sandbox game a lot better (not to mention it's cheaper); but if the sci-fi element is a must for you, go for Starbound instead, since while the worlds in that game aren't as big as the worlds in this game, the rest of the content more than makes up for that.

column8:
Most of the reviews point out the same thing, the game is abandoned by the devs. So why do I recommend the game?
I had fun.
The graphics are pretty good, the weapons and armor were fun to play around with and to fit different play styles the PIOS was ambitious and confusing at first, but does work. That said it, among many other things, still need work. The game never left beta and only did because the company folded. 

Bugs/crashing: I didn't come across any bugs. Not to say they don't exist or might be in the late game content though. Not one crash. Sure 15 hours isn't a ton of playtime, but that is still 15 hours without a single crash. (window 7 64, AMD, ATI hardware)

Abandonment: Don't pay full price if you are curious about the game, wait for a sale or bundle etc. I have to say that for me, it was worth the money spent (5$) for the time spent and amount of enjoyment I received. That said though, I don't really want to support a publisher who leaves unfinished games to just cash in on. A price reduction is certainly in order.

TL:DR - sound gfx and gameplay was fun but game was abandoned so any bugs/problems will never get fixed. Get on sale or skip. Or get Terraria.

column8:
Unity strikes again - well, it's not Unity's fault, but bad developers love to use Unity to inflict bad, unfinished products on Steam. 

This is basically almost a sci-fi ripoff of Terraria, it's a 2D platformer, lots of promise, no real reward.   They put some effort in, but ultimately a game should be fun.   And really, we've advanced beyond the limitation of PCs only capable of rendering graphics in 2D.  

There's no reason at all to go for this.   Uninteresting, clunky interface, bland gameplay.

column8:
Scam Alert! What a mess this was. They came out with a fun concept of a vertical based survival mining game and really goofed it up. Then when the chips were down and the sychopant chorus sang but it is early access it will be great when its done! They Notched it and released the buggy rough hewn work as a finished product and scuttled off with the dollary doo's. Yet another reason to never trust early access. 

A bit about the actual game is that you have to wait for machines to churn out recources you provide to progress. Then you have to complete dungeons using resources you harvested to access. Its a monotenous poorly scripted bullet hell that turns arbitrary resource gathering into a byzantine mess of mechinization and waiting around till you can get 45 nanocarbon fiber units or whatever you need to not die instantly in the next zone down. 

Remember: 

If the game is bad and unfinished after years of non progress like DayZ its never going to be done. 

If you buy a game like that and its got obvious bad spots where its poorly made has bad itemization or other red flags. Return it immediately!

Don't buy these games as jokes, you only support more of this. 

Finally just wait for the version counter to tick over to 1.0 before you buy!

column8:
Looks like it should be fun, kinda feels like Terraria in space but there seems to be no shortage of issues.
UI is clunky and downright broken in places
Controls are wonky and not really logical
The game seems riddled with bugs
Chugs in the weirdest of places (which shouldn't ever be an issue with a 2D side scroller...)

Basically it feels like an Early Access game that got 'promoted' too soon. Only saving grace for me was I got it in a Humble Bundle.

column8: i had this game for some time now, been expecting updates and maybe even better changes!  the changes only got slightly better and nothing else was extended to go down further onto the planet, nor better items and that is putting it lightly.  my own opinion, i am not happy at all with this game on their updates.  yes the game is fun but only to an extent and the atmospheric ambiant music is quite nice, but i would love this game finished!  it seems the devs are incredibly slow to non existant to this game when it needs attention.  when i mean slow, i mean as fast as a rock can move on its own.  i don't think this game will ever be finished and i had my hopes up for it back then.  seeing how this game now gets a lot of negative reviews, i agree with most on what they are saying about it.  now do i recommend this game?  not really... but play it at your own risk...

column8:
Merry Christmas, Cheery Saturnalia, Happy Hannukah, Good Kwanza, loving Yule...

Welp, if you are reading this I applaud you. 
I'm just gonna go all James Rofle on this.
With a name like "Edge of Space" yo feel as though there will be some adventure involved.
In the time it took to figure out how to install this hot pile of flaming garbage, I could have actually gone on an adventure to the stars, and met real aliens.
In the time it takes to create a character, I could have become the next Bill Gates.
In the time it takes the world generator to generate worlds, I was able to cook all of my family's christmas dinner.

(above was the TL;DR)

To start, I am running an Alienware area 51, with a an 8tb HDD, a 512gb ssd, 32 gigs of ddr4 overclocked to 5.8 gigahertz per second, an nvidia titan graphics card with 8 gb of onboard video memory...

During the install, the game got stuck at 12% for about an hour and a half, I had to restart the install 35 times before it actually passed that point. Next, the game wouldn't even load, like at all... I'm doing everything I can think of to fix this (aside from making a satanic sacrifice to Belzebub, and sacrficing the blood of the lamb, and the heart of the goat(jk))

After fixing the not launching problem, I waited at the "made with unity" screen for about an hour [3:00 pm].
After that, I had to create an avatar, and was completely unimpressed with the "creation".
I then had to generate a world, which was great, It gave me time to make the stuffing, mash the potatos, roast the turkey,  toss the salad, bake the kings cake, warm up my vocal cords to sing "God rest you merry gentleman" on the bass cleft, go caroling, throw the green bean casserole in the oven, have eggnog and share stories with old friends, (you get the picture).... and it still wasnt even half way done creating the world [7:00 pm].

finally at 11 pm, it had finished...




I waited for a few seconds, and then was pleased(hardcore sarcasam) with the results. terrible graphics, sketchy sound quality, and non responsive controls. after 30 minutes of gameplay, it had crashed, BSOD'ed in fact, I could have spent the $3.74 on a cheap pocket knife.

With love, Damien Shaydehart.

column8:
Please don't waste your time. this game is not only abandonded by its creators but it is really boring.

It does absolutely nothing to teach you how to play its game in a proper fashion. it expects you to do a bunch of reading and watching videos. and then if you skip that there is an npc with a LARGE amount of dialog to teach you more stuff.
I don't know about you fellow reader, but I like to learn

If you want to enjoy a side scrolling game you are much better off listening to the other reviews and aquire terraria or starbound. Starbound will at least give you a simple tutorial on how to play that you can also just skip. and terraria is simple enough to grasp but has SO much more content you can actually enjoy yourself.

Please, please dont get this game unless you really want a bad time.

column8:
Don't waste your money on this. Another early access game, full of promise , that ended up in the trash bin.
Nobody entirely understands what happened exactly.
I bought the game in it's Early Access. Was fun, despite the piles of bugs and issues all around everywhere.
Updates were consistent, and everything looked great! I always checked the news to see what wonderfull things they brought into the game, and it was fun trying out those features! Bugs were smashed, problems solved, and additional content added on the way. Everything looked pretty great!
Until it happened...
Still missing tons of content, they suddenly for no reason released the game!
One moment, there are regular updates with content and stuff and then poof, game released.
The soundtrack was amazing, perfectly fitting the environment, and better equipment was being added so that players could get to deeper biomes.
Then they decided to release it half-baked. There aren't even armor sets that would let you reach the deepest biomes!
Many biomes can't be reached at all! And tons of other stuff was missing still!
Combat was still very annoying, with enemies being extremely agile, having a very tiny hit-box, which sometimes wasn't even on the enemy! There was a crab enemy infamous of it's mis-placed hit box, because of which you could only hit it if you fire above it.
They kept releasing very tiny bug fix updates and smaller content updates, that only seemed to make them look like they were alive, when they didn't really add anything important.
Now, they have been silent for a long time.
The last post was a sort of "We are not dead but lots-a stuff going on now" post. They said in max a few months they would explain things. That post was put up in April.
Although nobody knows exactly what happened behind the curtains, but the most common idea is that the developers over time lost their determination to keep on going, and released the game early, turning it into a cash-grab.
The fact that even now, not having responded to anything for months, the game still gets put on sale, and once it was even sighted on humble bundle, only supports this cash grab idea even more. And then again, like i mentioned previously , before they went silent, they were releasing fake updates, that added nothing but thin-air to the game, only so that they make others think that the game is alive, when it is not.

TL;DR: Another early access game that had the potential and fun, but it mysteriously died out. Now it is only a carcass of a game that once was full of promise.

Once again, for a final time: Don't waste your money on this! I beg you...

column8:
Never understood why everybody started hating this game.
First it was too hard, so dev made it easier.
Then it was too clunky, so dev remade the UI again and again (it's still not perfect though but I saw big improvements overtime).
Then it was another thing and another one and no matter what dev team did, people were still mad at them ...
I did enjoy this game since the beginning, I adapted each time the game changed and yet people kept whining because it wasn't exactly how they felt it shoud have been.
After all this hard work and still getting pooped in the face, the dev team left ... how strange, right ?

I'm not mad at the dev team, but I'm so sad that people can't understand that making others miserable because they don't have exactly what they want (and having paid for it is no excuse to this behavior in my opinion) will make them give up on their task ...

For what it's worth, I miss you Handyman team :(, but thank you anyway for the actual game cause I really don't feel that I've been robbed and I still enjoy it from time to time.

column8: I REALLY wanted to like this game. But the instructions are sadly lacking. I still have no clue what rock (I have 24) or clay (I have 2) looks like even though I have 2 in my inventory and using the jet pack is iffy at best. Sometimes holding the SPACE and UP ARROW together works to get me back to my cryopod from the asteroid below but mostly it just makes me jump up over and over. It's too bad the devs didn't spend more time on getting the tutorial to work (they apparently abandoned it) because I think this could be a really great game. But in it's current state, I have to give it a "thumbs down".

column8:
This is not a bull review, i'm just gonna point the pros and cons, then move on with my day.
I haven't even played an hour, but i still feel as though i should make a review

Pros
-Amazing pixel artwork, when i first opened it up i legit said "Woah".
-Creative ideas, you know, the first thing I didn't think of was a flying, talking, robot shark in space
-Quantity, there is so much stuff to explore and find, it's ridiculous
-Natural spawns, I love how the first thing a explored was a zombie containment plant
-Plot, not much plot, you get lost in another planet, galaxy, whatever, then you explore it
-Jet Pack, Cool, and i love how you start with it and you can explore terrain easier
-Potential, this game has MASSIVE potential, it needs more stuff though
-SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE

Cons
-What do i do, like seriously, I have no idea what i'm doing, none of my friends have this game so i can't ask anyone
-it seems like it's copying starboun-- no it can't be... can it?
-Your first weapon is a jello gun, you can't even kill a crab in 3 shots, it's so weak
-it takes a second to load up, and the frames are not great but not bad, and I have a pretty good Graphics card

Needs
-Entertaining tutorials
-A better jet pack
-A better gun
-And better frames

None the less, I still enjoy playing this game from time to time ðŸ‘

column8: Steam should banned this developer as they abandoned the game.
column9: Steam should banned this developer as they abandoned the game.

column8:
THIS GAME IS AN EARLY ACCESS SCAM

Developers realized their game wasn't working out and had too many issues to fix.  But instead of telling their customers this, they rushed to a "Full Release" version that was hilariously unfinished in September 2015 so they could get the game featured on the Steam Store Front Page right before the holidays.

They strung it along further by releasing constant "Minor updates" up through December 2015.  These updates weren't actually intended to fix their horribly broken game, but intended to keep it showing on the Steam Store Front Page as "Recently Updated" throughout the 2015 holiday season.

In January 2016, by all appearances, this developer had stopped all development.  The community manager had left, they were inactive on Social Media and Steam, and nothing was done to fix the games issues.

In April 2016, they posted a vague "Please be patient" message on Steam via a private steam account (Which, to this day, doesn't respond to inquiries about the game).  By "Coincidence", one month later, in May 2016, the game is featured in a Humble Indie Bundle.  The April Post was done simply to make potential Humble Bundle buyers believe that the game is being actively developed and supported were they to check it's news page.  The devs apparently had no intention of continuing work on the game, they just wanted to string folks along and milk every last dime they could from sales, even from within the Humble Bundle.

Their website and forums were taken down after the domain names are currently up for sale.  None of their social media accounts (Facebook, Twitter, ect) have posted anything or responded to anything.  E-Mails are unanswered.  No new activity on Steam.

This is a classic "Take the money and run" Early-Access scam, on par with what the developers of Towns did.  This needs to stop.  DO NOT buy this game.  If you do, you support these practices.  I bought into the game in it's Early Alpha stages and regret doing so.  Spread the word about developers like this and be more discerning in the future about your Early Access Purchases.  That's the only way this kinda crap is going to stop.

OST is ok, but don't get that at full price. Instead, use the money to crowdfund a class action lawsuit against the devs and if possible criminal action. I won't do either because lazy, but if I can get $5 in even just steam credit because of it I'll take it.

column8:
Well, it's been a few years of following EoS through Early Access and beyond, and while re-writes of the UI, introduction and progression were *really* good improvements over what existed prior, they're unfinished - egregiously in places - and the game in itself is unpleasant to play.

Could be fixed, but in the 10 months of radio silence... it doesn't look likely. 

Avoid - there's better games that deliver a more complete experience.

column8:
I simply cannot recommend the game in this state.

I was trying to wait out for updates, I was trying to wait for the developers to come back from their "logistics stuff" that they've been doing for months (it doesn't take that long for someone or even multiple people to move), and the developers have seemingly fallen off the face of the planet (maybe into the Edge of Space!? lol, couldn't resist, sorry).

Starbound did a similar thing where Chucklefish relocated their entire company, but yet here's the thing: Chucklefish at least continued to maintain their website, and actually continued communications with the playerbase. Since Handyman Studios posted that update in April (It is October as I write this), there hasn't been any communication whatsoever, except for 1 tweet that advertised the game being on sale somewhere.

So, since this appears to be abandonware, I believe I can attach my own review of this game.

Do I recommend it as it is now? NO.
Do I think it could be a good game? YES, but only if the developers actually come back.
Do I hope they would come back and make it better? YES!

The game has a nice premise going for it, but there are simply too many things wrong with it to make it an actual good purchase. If you really want a tech demo to mess around with, maybe for inspiration or ideas, go ahead. I'd wait until it's on sale, though.

So, Pros/Cons:

Pros: 

-A nice recipe unlock system
-Good graphics for a sidescrolling indie game
-Lots of inventive ideas (pets, character upgrades, etc)
-A unique take on the sandbox exploration game (you progress by going down)
-You start with a jetpack

Cons:

-Control/UI Bugs (your character will shoot their weapon or use their tool while dragging items around in the UI)
-Unfinished game and obvious missing content (the last two biomes are not finished, some tech unlocks are empty)
-Blah combat (you always feel weak as bleeep because your guns all suck, and it takes 10+ shots to kill anything)
-Melee combat is useless
-Cheap enemies that can fly through solid walls to attack you
-Dungeons are buggy, some of those bugs were fixed in the last update, but some remain from what I've been told
-No Real Map System (this is the huge deal-breaker for me -- you only have a "current" minimap of what you can currently see and that's it)
-Somewhat clunky UI system (inventory management, everything freshly obtained gets dumped into the hotbar etc)
-UI LAG. Yes, the UI lags when trying to move items around.

Recap: A game that has/had a lot of potential but sadly fell way short. I tried hard to like this game, because when I first started playing it, I was like "I hope they finish this game or make it better!" But sadly.. it doesn't look like that will ever come to pass. If you're a game developer and you're looking for some inspiration, I'd suggest picking this game up on sale, maybe someone else can develop something else that is similar but way better?

column8: Ð˜Ð³Ñ€Ð° Ð½Ðµ Ñ€Ð°Ð·Ð²Ð¸Ð²Ð°ÐµÑ‚ÑÑ.

I actually enjoyed this game when it was in Early Access. I felt it had a lot of potential. To be honest, this and Darkout (another failed "sandbox-style" game) are the games that got me interested in the genre.

But now, the game has been released from Early Access incomplete - there is no story to speak of, some NPC quests are still broken, some recipes are still broken, overall balance is lacking, some deep biomes/strata are broken/bugged/non-functional, and the game is poorly optimized. It should have never left Early Access.

Add on to that, there has been no news on the game in six months (as of this posting), said news being a vague-yet-ominous post about a future announcement yet to materialize, the official game page has turned into a GoDaddy parking page, and the developer has reportedly closed doors.

I wanted to believe in this game, for Laser-Guided Flying Space Sharks with Human Teeth if nothing else, but in this state, unfinished and apparently abandoned, I cannot recommend it to anybody.

column8:
I really want to enjoy this game, sadly I cannot. There are many UI problems and the whole thing seems too archaic and clunky to operate. Even with the tutorial videos I find myself struggling with basic things that even checking the key-mappings donâ€™t reveal. One such example is how do you change the orientation of an object you are placing? How do you make that bed face left instead of right? The entire game is frustrating in this respect.

The developers appear to have disappeared. Even the Handyman Studios website has long gone down.

Edge of Space is far from a finished product, yet it appears that the Devs pushed a 1.0 release, a few fixes post release, then abandoned the whole game.

Most disappointing, particularly as the game was sold with â€œOfficial Terrariaâ€ themed objects suggesting it would be a game of the same standard. It is not.

Thoroughly disappointing and in itâ€™s current state I would have to say a very clear â€œDO NOT BUYâ€.

column9: Fire it up! If you haven't played for an adult, you have to start the game from scratch. You create a new world, and it takes 15 minutes to load, but it's 90% stuck and you can't even enter the world. Also, looking at the so-called news, the latest was on April 30th, which, judging by other comments, should be 2016. There was an announcement of a pause in updates. Those Russians are so irresponsible! They take money, play a couple of games, and then leave... If that's the case, why didn't they put miniclip up from the beginning, giving people free access and relying on ads? It's clearly a scam!!! I'm onl99 and they're making it even better, and they even put white sauce on it. Don't fall for their tricks.

column8: I cannot recommend this in good conscience.  There are many aspects of this game that I enjoy (largely, the overall concept/game idea) but the fact that the devs have more or less abandoned the game makes the delays and/or broken aspects of the game many of us have dealt with for months/years rather frustrating.  Things like the poor transition from biomes, the EXTREMELY poor hotbar usage, or the unfinished dungeons all add up to unfulfilled expectations.  In the end, I want to recommend this game but too many broken promises (and yes, me being an EA adopter is my fault, I accept that) lead to caveat emptor at this point.

The game feels like grinding, boring endless repetitive grinding, the new materials feel like the old ones, the enemies are overwhelming some times and some times totally boring but the MOST irritating thing: It is FUKKING SLOW. I don't have a top of line computer, but it runs Fallout 4 on low graphics and fallout 3 on full. And it can NOT run this fucking game in a decent framerate. THIS IS A SIMPLES 2D GAME! It is absurd how lagged, with poor framerate the game feels. It does not make any sense. This and all the other critics you can freely read in the page. Would neve recomend. Go play terraria or starbound.

column8:
The most dissapointing part of this game is that theres proof that it's went to $41T, ingame if you click the steam rewards button, it would originally take you to a place to redeem codes for exclusive items (see hollow gear and greenlight helmet) now if you click that button you are taken to a "website for sell" domain, So, i originally left an unhelpful and stupid good review on this game, i've since deleted that review and this game from my pc. This game is far from finished and seems to be abandoned, though it is a good sandbox, and good for people who want to build, but I suggest starbound for better building. it's sad and such a shame that this game had so much potential and has since been seemingly abandoned even though the devs say it's not...I hope they're truthful as I'd like to see this game become more than it is. but i've had requests to update this review to be more helpful, thus pros and cons will follow:

Pros
+Questing system
+Story and Background
+Dungeons, Events, Etc.
+Npc's must be found around the world
+Unique fragmented world, and the further you drop the tougher it gets
+Unique and fun research/upgrade system
+Challenging, and fun pass time
+Sandbox
+(to my recolection) you loose nothing upon death (maybe a few research points if that, correct if wrong)

Cons
-Seemingly Abandoned (the devs say it's not, I hope they're right, explained in comment)
-No more exclusive/event rewards (unknown if will return, see greenlight helmet and hollow armor)
-Repetitive
-Quests can progress faster than you (power, level, distance wise, etc.)
-Sometimes a bit too challenging
-...as of right now, I can't think of any more

so untill this game is back to updating and no longer seems abandoned, this review will remain negative, (I would chose neutral or abstain if possible because this game can be fun sometimes)

column9:
The game looks nice and has a lot of content, but the tutorial is absolute crap because it doesn't even begin to explain enough about the game, leaving you completely helpless.

Some of you are probably thinking: Wow, how difficult can it be? You just have to immerse yourself in the game. And yes, it isn't difficult; it's just tiring when you repeatedly mess up your skills, repeatedly die from radiation, repeatedly get flattened by enemies that are way too strong, and repeatedly fall through the surface of this damn hollow earth.

column8: Okay so this game is a 2D sandbox game that basically tried to rip off terraria or starbound... the game is litterally a mess I am supprised a youtuber I watched even told his viewers to check it out, when you load into the game you spawn at this point and the game throws a crappy instruction manual in your face with a video that only explains half of the controls. I feel like half way through making this game all the devs where just like "I'm gonna go take a really long coffee break." and just left the game half way completed, in the end this game is a sad excuse for a game at all... when I started my world I jumped off one of my plantes to check out more, there was a zombie nest but there was no possible way for me to kill the zombies the game told me nothing of how to get farther, basically if you want to get any where in this game you have to look it up! I can't believe this "game" costs more that a dollar if you are considering buying it... Don't!!

column8:
"Promise" is what I saw when I got this game. My friend got it on an impulse buy so I had to get it too. So to out do them, I got the Special Edition. We couldn't even play together, it was so buggy, and it still is, after 1.5 years. Now, I'd be happy to overlook the multiplayer problems if the singleplayer was fun/even slightly entertaining, but it's not even terraria, it's just boring. The Special Edition didn't even work when the game was 'released', it just kept crashing the game. I wasted a 25 dollar giftcard I could have bought StarBound with, what a disapointing mess.

If you want to see evidence for yourself, go to http://playedgeofspace.com this WAS their website where you could recive free stuff in-game.

column8:
If you are looking for a review for this pice of garbage, then this is not the place.  If you want to read a childrens book than this IS the place.

The sun did not shine.  It was too wet to play.  So we say in the house All that cold, cold, wet day.
I say there with Sally.  We say there, we too.  And I said, "how I wish we had something to do!"
Too wet to go out and too cold to play ball.  So we say in the house.  We did nothing at all.
So all we could do was sit! sit! sit!  And we did not like it. Not one little bit.
And then somehting went BUMP!  How that bumb made us jump!
We looked! Then we saw him stem in on the mat!  We looked! And we saw him!  The Cat in the Hat!  And he said to us, "Why sit there like that?"
"I know it is wet and the sun is not sunny.  Bu we can have lots of good fun that is funny!"
"I know some good games we couldplay," said the Cat in the Hat.  "A lot of good tricks I will show them to you.  Your mother will not mind at all if I do."  Then Sally and I did not know what to say.  Our mother was out of the house for the day.  JUMP SCARE! But our fish said "No! No! Make that cat go away! Tell the cat to go away!  Tell that Cat in the hat you do not want to smoke weed, it is unhelth my dear little babe.  He should not be here he should not be about.  He should not be here when your mother is out!
"Now now! have no fear.  Gaben is here!" Said the cat in the hat "My tricks are not bad" said the Cat in the Hat.  "Why we can have lots of fun, if you with with a game that I call up-up-up with a fish!"
"Put me down!" said the fish.  "This is no fun at all! Put me down!" said the fish.  "I do not wish to fall!"
"Have no fear!" said the cat.  "If you fall and die I am sure someone will revive you, thats how it works m8" said the Cat.
And then the cat did stuff, it was lame, I don't want to type that all, I am lazy.  SOOOO,  thing one and two came out and saved the day and everything was fine and stuff and Blizzard plz don't sent me to jail for plagerism, I don't deserve that.  BTW this is not my story it is The Cat In The Hat by Dr. Seuss!  Ha can't get me now i saved myself, dunked on.  What am I doing with my life, ah well at least this was still more fun than playing Edge of Space, the game is bad.  RIP OG I though miricle could do it but he failed us all.  Hello whoever is reading this still, save yourself while you still can.  Now to make this narratiaon end I will put of a PSA:

Hey kids! anyone ever told you to drink bleach?!? well it kills you so don't fall for it, it's a trap.

GG WP!

column8:
Sigh, was really hoping some of the other Terraria in space games would pan out, but this is so inferior to Terraria or Starbound that I can't even recommend it if you're desperate.

Even if you think 'Terraria in space' is unfair for anything to live up to, the game is abandoned early access trash and not worth it even on its own merits. If it ever gets a transformative update, I'll gladly wipe this review.

In the mean time, try [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/248390/]Craft the World[/url] instead.  No, it's not the same but it's far more polished than this, and once you get the hang of not directly controlling an avatar, far more enjoyable.

column8:
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH



Esto no es terraria del futuro, compren starbound.

Took a bit to get into but overall I liked it.  Definitely think a few things could change but it wasn't as bad as some of these reviews seem to be portraying it.  I didn't like the completely polarised armour for sure.  If you want a decent amount of inventory you need to give up health and damage, if you want damage you can't have inventory or health, etc.  That bugged me because I don't want to keep 3 sets of armour on me at all times just in case.  I think the worst thing though is that in the late tier you get some special weapons and tools but they can only be used while wearing a very specific armour.  So unless you want to carry that armour and the tool these great items become entirely useless.  Levelling also seems to be a huge grind.  I ended up just creating the machines that mine quickly and straight up hollowing out entire massive chunks of land to get the xp (I think it has a name in the game though, like Research or something instead of xp).  I still found it fun to progress solo, though.  One of this games big issues is the crafting system.  It would be really nice if you could initiate crafting while in a chest's inventory so that both your inventory and the chest's would be checked for crafting materials.  Its really annoying to have to constantly take small things from chests for each thing you need to make, especially since there are so many different materials in this game (which is a good thing but cumbersome in this case).

Tl;dr Its a good game but it takes a bit of dedication.  And if you aren't the type to look past small issues or annoyances then this might not be great for you.

column8:
This game has promise - is what I would have said over 2 years ago now. 

When I first got it, I loved it! The aesthetics were appealing and it was like a fresh new take on terraria, one of my top played games at that time. After about 20 hours I was just screwing around in the "end game" with my buddy who I bought the game for as well (got a 2-pack because I liked the idea so much) 

And.. that was it. I was going to try playing again and went over the patch history, and it was basically barren. In fact it hasn't even  been touched once this year.

Fortunately about 6 months after I bought this game I purchased Starbound, haven't looked back. If you're reading this and you're interested in a fun sci-fi side scroller just go for Starbound! It has the same sandbox elements with an actual story integrated, and about 100x as many features as this game. 

Thank you for your time, and RIP Edge of Space.

column9:
Pros:
1) Sandbox with fantasy elements (the only one in its genre)
2) Atmosphere, thanks to good voice acting and the game's style
3) Unique system for transitioning from one biome to another
4) Variety of equipment: implants, auxiliary
pets, mounts, jetpack, vehicles,
weapons (of various types, different elements), and armor (for hunting, exploring, and mining).
5) Special character customization slots
6) Shooting system (recoil, bullet trajectory, etc.)
7) Game price
8) Temporary events: weather changes, killing groups of monsters, survival missions, etc.
9) Unique crafting (all resources are divided into types; for example, to craft armor, you need metal, so you can use either aluminum, titanium, or something else) and more...

Cons:
1) Not the most user-friendly interface
2) Bugs

Normally only post reviews for games I enjoy. However, this game was awful enough that I had to post something.  I didn't buy this game when it released, nor when it was in early access. No, I KICKSTARTED this game. That was the promise and intrigue I had in this game. But it is just a slap in the face. Developers, which started out with constant updates, began to slowly abandon the game. The graphics, which are actually painful to look at, never got better. The crafting system is unique but just so unpolished. This game is a complete disgrace to the games it is copying.

column8:
I have over 100 hours into this game and I've been here since Alpha.  I've played through about 3 revisions of the game, so about 40 hours or so per playthrough.  The game went thru some major changes since Alpha, and even though it's not 100% finished, and hasn't gotten any updates as of lately, it was an extremely fun game to play.  The fact it's unfinished really doesn't change much, as there's no main storyline, it's more of an exploration, creation, and upgrade game.

The Penguin music alone is worth the money I paid for this game while it's on sale.  There's 3 completed biomes of enemies, thousands of items, I think like 45+ full sets of armor, 3 seperate lines with different attribute upgrades and abilities, and a bunch of alien techs to find that upgrade your passives.

In short I'm completely happy with my purchase.  I hope they add more content in the future but I well got my moneys worth.  This game in alpha felt more complete then most of the crap I buy nowadays anyways.  It plays ALOT like Terraria.     I have no idea why so many haters due to one biome being unfinished, but I'd totally recommend this game, especially if you like Terraria.  Don't listen to the haters.

column8:
When you launch the game, it tries to take you to the developer's webpage for news. Instead of seeing the developer's webpage, you get a 404 error because this game is partially completed abandonware with terrible game balance, boring non-objectives, and a ridiculously counter-intuitive crafting system that serves little point.

Terraria is less expensive, has 50 times as much content, a working map, active and engaged developers who continue to pile on new free content even years after release, and isn't a boring and ill-thought out disaster of a game.

Do not buy this. I made that mistake. You don't need to repeat it.

I bought this game a long time ago, (over 3 years ago?), and played it much more offline than my stats show. The game developers have most certainly abandoned this game, with no progress made in months, and game breaking bugs and issues abound. Sadly, the worst part is even if it wasn't plagued with bugs and it's developers didn't abandon it, it still isn't "fun." 

TLDR: Abandoned. Play Terraria or Starbound instead. Starbound is an example of Great Early Access Devs. These guys? Ruin Early Access for everyone.

column9:
4.5/10

This game is weaker than the competition in all attributes. You can find a lot of games of the same genre that are not early access.
Edge of Space is officially out, but you'll start laughing the first time you start it. the game doesn't even have a title background, just a mess created probably by some beginning graphics student, painted by copying a small picture with a few stars 12 times next to each other. An abandoned game that has nothing to offer, but the potential would be there.

column8:
This game was another shining example of how flawed early access really is.

Gameplay - 4 (gameplay is extremely clunky, boring and the whole game feels like a chore)

Graphics - 3 (This is opinion obviously but I think this game is ugly, the color pallete is not coherent)

There isn't much more to talk about, this game is meh at best, it took them way too long to get in key features like Coop and any kind of progression system and the game to this day has been abandoned with many bugs.

4/10 - Avoid like a Jehovah's Witness.

column8:
Eh. That is the one word to describe this game.

It is an ok Open-world, sandboxy game, the areas are different, the enemies are kinda cool, the boss(es? I have only seen one) is/are ok. So when you start, everything seems like it will be good...BUT this game falls short. After playing for about an hour you will be bored as hell, you have to grind a huge amount for anything, missions are stupid as they don't work very well and all armour, upgrades, etc feel the same. No weapon seems unique or fun for that matter.

This is coming from someone who has not played with friends, maybe it is a really fun multiplayer game? I don't know but If you want to/ think it looks fun then give it a try but I wouldn't recommend it too much. 

I really want to like this game and recommend it, but I just can't. It has too many issues.

5/10 Fun for a short while then gets boring

column8:
Regretful and disappointed.
I have about eighty-four hours invested into Edge of space. (with about one third of my time in pre-release, over 404 hours in Terraria in comparison). It was exhilarating  to see a game with the science-fiction setting in the genre. I wanted to like this game, but it's been a letdown overall. Exploration and expansion become quite hindered by your armor and weapons. Crafting remains over-complex and tedious. It is all too easy to sink hours looking for resources that are a little -too- scarce. Items take sometimes a half-dozen ingredients to make (which themselves take several crafting stations). In comparison to Terraria, most items take three or fewer (excluding endgame content). This game is an example of a great premise bogged down by poor development. This is one of the few games I keep trying every so often to see if they've fixed it, and so far they haven't. I'm not yet at the point where I wish I could trade or return it, but I'm not too far from that either.

It was exhilarating  to see a game with the science-fiction setting in the genre. I wanted to like this game, but it's been a letdown overall. Exploration and expansion become quite hindered by your armor and weapons. Crafting remains over-complex and tedious. It is all too easy to sink hours looking for resources that are a little -too- scarce. Items take sometimes a half-dozen ingredients to make (which themselves take several crafting stations). In comparison to Terraria, most items take three or fewer (excluding endgame content). This game is an example of a great premise bogged down by poor development. This is one of the few games I keep trying every so often to see if they've fixed it, and so far they haven't. I'm not yet at the point where I wish I could trade or return it, but I'm not too far from that either.

column8:
99% of the bad reviews are from attention w hore trolls. Nothing more. Most of them have OVER 100+ hours of gameplay. (Yeah! The game must really F-king suck if they sunk 100+ hours into it Am-I-RIGHT? )

Here are some facts:
[list]
[*]Game is 100% playable, and you can finish it in about 2 weeks of 8 hour days playing. (I timed my wife's second runthough, exactly 89 hours to complete on easy for an experianced player.)

[*]Multiplayer works, and YES there are a lot of people populating them. (although a large ammount of them are locked like most multi-player games of this sort).

[*]Co-Op with 3 of your friends is a blast!

[*]Neat electrical system!! You get to actually plan out your base so you get the most out of your power sources.

[*]LOTS of cool creatures with verry unique traits/attacks/funny habbits.

[*]Lots of minerals, and things to craft with! Lots of things to craft!!! Lots of Decorations so you can really personalize your base. 

[*]Some of the bosses are from Terraria!!! The maker of terraria LOVES this game, and gave a blessing, and the rights to use Skeletron!!!
https://www.engadget.com/2013/08/29/terraria-content-coming-to-edge-of-space-in-cross-over-event/

[*] Great music and atmosphere.

[*] Creative artists, the worlds are verry much ALIVE. and beutiful!
[/list]

Development is going to be starting up again as soon as the Developer takes a well earned Holiday. All of the fun is not over!! This game is not done yet!!!!

The "This game is abandoned" troll, is an outright f-king lie.

column8:
Edge of space parece ser um jogo em early access. 
Muitas mecanicas sÃ£o confusas e mal explicadas.
Falta um pouco de game design, principalmente pelo que diz respeito aos bosses/dungeons. Repetitivos e demorados.
Um jogo muito focado em co-op. 
Apesar destes pontos, ainda Ã© um jogo que vale a pena experimentar. 
Cheio de mecanicas inovadoras em comparaÃ§Ã£o a outros "terraria-likes", Edge of Space Ã© um diamante bruto que a equipe deixou de lapidar.
column9:
Edge of Space appears to be an early access game.

Many mechanics are confusing and poorly explained.

The game design is somewhat lacking, especially regarding the bosses/dungeons. They're repetitive and time-consuming.

The game is heavily focused on co-op.

Despite these issues, it's still a game worth trying.

Full of innovative mechanics compared to other Terraria-likes, Edge of Space is a diamond in the rough that the team failed to polish.

column8:
Edge of space is a waste of time and Money. The Crafting and building is ok but the grind to get the needed ressources for better equipment is plain boring and way to slow and the building Options are to limited. Combat is boring and there are like 10 enemys total in the game. Bosses and dungeons are ok the first time but the dungeons dont change and when you have to farm them for mats they get boring fast. All of that is topped with an unlogical research and upgrade system and a barren last biome.

If you like a rpg variant of Terraria try Crea instead, If you have never played and 2d  Sandbox Platformer try Terraria. 
If you really want to lose 15 bucks i can give you my bankdetails, that way you at least saved your lifetime :)

Permabanned on forums for pointing out, the devs pushed out beta updates, which added content, but locked that content behind drops that were unattainable, so noone could test said new content, this was about a year ago.
Since then they pushed to release and have since bailed, even the Community manager moved to pastures new, while the dev team hire themselves out as 3rd party coders (sorry that should probably read as 3rd rate coders).

Full release still has a lot of unfinished content, and serious game breaking bugs, esp where multiplayer is concerned, so far the devs have blamed " logistical things" for their abscence, with a more detailed explanation forthcoming...but coming up for two months later and those things are still restricting them, but doesnt stop them playing a lot of Overwatch...go figure.

column8:
This is one of those "Had amazing potential, shot itself in the foot, then to try fixing things, shot itself in the other foot" type of games.

In the Early Access, it needed a bit of polishing, and some tightening, but overall wasn't too bad. And then they took out the tutorial, but fixed the UI a bit. And then that sort of thing became a trend. Take out an important bit, fix a semi-important bit, so overall, it got slightly worse.

And now you  have a game that is, while playable, has a poor UI, no tutorial or useful start to speak of, and the worst thing; it feels like all the fun this game could have been was very specifically surgically removed.

Maybe it was. After all, they had to remove something to put in the Robot Shark NPC at the last minute.

column8:
I bought this game almost the same day it was released as early access, at first i really enjoyed it and it showed a lot of promise. But it quickly became appearent that the developers really didnt have a well thought out plan for their game. I've seen the leveling and crafting system completely overhauled several times over and in the end they settled for a complete illogical mess.

They then added dungeons and bosses, which are also a complete mess and some of the most boring things i've ever encountered.

They added some more biomes with quirky and severly annoying and overpowered creatures. They are incredibly annoying and can spawn in large numbler right on top of you. They move erraticly and in all manner of illogical ways and this combined with the horrible combat system makes it all just painful. They didnt add enough biomes in the game either so the last one is just a barren lifeless landscape with nothing to explore.

Considering the vast number of other good sandbox sidescrollers out there i really dont see any reason for you to purchase this one, especially not now since the dev's have completely abandoned it before completetion.

I've seen the leveling and crafting system completely overhauled several times over and in the end they settled for a complete illogical mess.

They then added dungeons and bosses, which are also a complete mess and some of the most boring things i've ever encountered.

They added some more biomes with quirky and severly annoying and overpowered creatures. They are incredibly annoying and can spawn in large numbler right on top of you. They move erraticly and in all manner of illogical ways and this combined with the horrible combat system makes it all just painful. They didnt add enough biomes in the game either so the last one is just a barren lifeless landscape with nothing to explore.

Considering the vast number of other good sandbox sidescrollers out there i really dont see any reason for you to purchase this one, especially not now since the dev's have completely abandoned it before completetion.

column8:
Overall:
I think that in it's current state the game shows a ton of potential and has some very great features. I really like the Terraria/Starbound 2D worldcraft type gameplay and the controls/combat of this particular title does the style justice. If you're a fan of these, this game is a must-play as it is a bit more forgiving than Starbound or Terraria in some ways but also very challenging in it's own right.

Positives:
There is a great amount of appealing content in the game so far. The combat is a lot of fun. I like how easy it is to find and upgrade resources as well as unlocking content by simply fighting monsters and mining. Each (fighting/mining) give you exp points equally. There are also mini-dungeons you come across regularly to clear out. These in addition to deployable tower defense and other styles of mini-game dungeons adds a fun spin to the roguelike worldcraft indie style.

Negative:
The biggest issues I have with the game are stability issues and bugs. After initially binging on the game for several hours, I lost everything I had built due to a client crash. I still had my character and all the inventory, but the planet/area's safe file was corrupted so I had to start from a fresh new save. This made me lose all my storage and the structures/bases I had built.  Also it seems that about half the time the game has trouble deploying your character as playable into the world. Sometimes the screen is dark and everything responds, but you cannot move or take control of your avatar. It is easily fixed by a restart or two (if it happens sequentially). 

Neutral:
This game isn't a solid world like in Terraria or Starbound. There are large open spaces inbetween land masses that you must use your jet pack to travel between while heading deeper in the map without taking damage on impact as the gravity is similar to that of earth. This I feel like has both negative and positive effects for creating elevator shafts and fast-travel between different levels. For instance, one thing I liked about terraria was creating an easily navigated mine-shaft to drop very deep very quickly, although in this you can just build a teleporter wherever you want and teleport straight to it. So it really allows you to focus on more combat if you want to.

End thoughts. Worth overall. I will update my review as it is developed.

column8:
I enjoyed the game. It has a nice mix of Terraria-style exploring and base building and fast-paced Metroid-style shooting. It has vehicles, a decent progression system, quests and NPCs.

Sure, it has some downsides (most annoyingly UI lag) and parts of the game feel unfinished (vehicles IMO could be much more useful than they currently are). But overall I found the game reasonably enjoyable and don't quite get all the negativity (I think it's more of a case of unmet expectations than the game being objectively bad).

column9:
Edge of Space is a game that's hard to navigate because there's so much to do, but if you play the game long enough, it all becomes less complicated.

-The game has many types of weapons

-The game has various crafting stations

-The game also has many types of armor

-There are also bosses in the game (fun to fight if you have the right equipment)

-You can also play multiplayer (I don't think there are servers)

-There are many types of enemies

-The game has many different vehicles

-The game also has many types of blocks

-The game simply has so much content that it's impossible for some to keep track of it all

-So the game isn't suitable for everyone

Overall rating: 8/10

column8:
It's been a while since I've played this game, mainly since the last update came out December 2015. What I mainly remember about this game is that it felt slow and unsatisfying.

Unrelated to the game directly: [spoiler] At this rate I wonder if this game will reach the same fate as [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/204960/]Magical Drop V [/url], another buggy game that has gone YEARS without an update. Actually, this game is still more playable than that one and they at least said something. This game does not have a childhood connection like MDV does though. [/spoiler]

The only good thing about this game is the title/main theme, which you can listen to [url=https://youtu.be/VLiQxIR8B8s]here[/url]. If you don't like that either, this game has nothing to offer to you that hasn't been done better by others.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Dec 29, 2019

Out of morbid curiosity, I sometimes check back on games I own that were abandoned and such. Strangely enough, I got an OC out of this game. In the long run, she'll probably get more development than this game did as a whole.

column8:
I can't write a real in-depth review because I'm not sure if I want to play this for much longer - it feels rushed, really rushed, with a lot of design and gameplay problems.
You get xp from basically doing anything, and you can spend it on unlocking further tiers of sciences - but there are so, so many branches that's absurd. Melee weapon, energy weapon, projectile weapon, phase weapon - four different ones. Explorer, fighter and builder armor, utility, consumables - it's overbearing and really hard to notice what's useful. Crafting is also a mess - it's great that you can multiple materials when the recipe only asks for *metal*, but you need to pick the chosen one from a drop-down menu. There's an autofill button that uses the lowest tier? most abundant? resource of yours, but in that case I don't know why is that not the basic option. Not to mention that opening one dropdown menu doesn't closes the other, and they overlap - I can't believe this is happening in a finished, released game. And finding the actual items from the crafting menu is just a nightmare - if you check "all", there are too many options, but other than that, you can filter by type. And you know what does that mean - even more dropdown menu, trying to find out which one has a craftable, or even a useful item in it.
Graphics are vibrant coloured ones, but it's like someone smeared something opalesque on it - hard to take out silhouettes, the size of the blocks, the aim of weapons/tools.    But hey, we have a spaceshark companion who's sounds are like a girl whining in an anime... ON A SPACESHARK.... just... no.
If I should summerize the game in a world, I would say  it's  unintuitive. But to a high level.  Stay away from this one - Terraria still provides so much fun and depth, and even Windforge has more style with it's weird 2.5D graphics than this game :\  Maybe I'll come back to force some progress, but this game is a definite NOT RECOMMENDED.  Not to mention that the 15â‚¬ price is infuriatingly high.

I first found this game a few versions ago and was a bit unimpressed...
You needed to be a programmer to figure anything out, there was no direction or indication of what half of everything was and most of the game's features seemed to be 'almost useful'.

I am glad to say that game is no more and this one now stands on it's own and holds weight!
Sure, it's still early days and some things need tweaking, adding to, explaining etc... but this game has come so far in such a short time that it's gone from 'complicated mess' to 'diamond in the rough'.

I enjoy playing this and will add to this review as the game improves.

column8: If you are the type of person who is ok with having to remember on your own every detail of every inch of your world as you explore it, or are one of those people who can go exploring, end up in a running barrle, and die and know exactly how to get back to where you got by sheer accident than mayby you will like this game, for the rest of us I would say don't bother.  there is no in game world map, just a mini map.  it is entirely possible to fall through a series of areas and get completely lost.  there is no way to see where you were to get back there, you have to memorize everything, and for people like me that play once in a while you have no idea where everything was.  the nature of this games series of floating islands is what really inflames the problem.  unlike in games like terraria, a great deal of your time will be exploring by traveling through empty sky to see what is out there.  if you miscalculate your fall angle for the return trip you will miss what you found completely.  it is similar to trying to recreate a randm painting as a connect the dots puzzle when you can only see the dots your pencil tip is next to.

column8:
Yet another testament to the great Kickstarter/Early Access deluge of 2014. 

The game has, as near as I can tell, been completely abandoned by the developers and the community manager, with one of the former regularly going on about a new project he's working on. 

No one from the dev team appear to have been anywhere near the Steam forums (nor the official forums, from what little I checked) for around three months now. 

The game seemed interesting enough, with an interesting (if somewhat grindy) Science XP mechanic, wherein mining and killing critters got you Science XP to unlock crafting tiers. 

Sadly, attempting to load a game, or even start a new world with a saved character causes a Coherent UI crash, which the devs have never fixed. IF you are able to get your world to load then you will be stuck without a HUD. No way to manage your inventory, and no way to transfer/drop/change items. Crafting is also impossible. 

tl;dr? Yet another dead, abandoned game that serves as a testament against Kickstarters and Early Access.

Edit: And this is what you're greeted with when you start the game.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=823926715
column9:

well ive spent about 20 hours on this game and i can say that at this point the game is just not worth playing anymore. 

Exploring: its pretty standard, you go out find monsteres and stuff and you need to kill them to get their materials. most are nutral, some aren't. they have little zones with events like "kill the zombies", "kill the crabs, "Save an NPC" which are fun but super short, like done in 1 min and thats it" 

Building: building is pretty similar to other games of its like. you dont need as many as other games from what i can tell. 
getting new building recipes is pretty unique. you get XP for everything you do, and you trade in that xp for new teirs of items. 

Fighting: the fighting was pretty standard, thir weapons and teir systems are so annoying that finding the right weapons was just a chore. it doesn't say what the possible damage of the weapons are you just have to build them and hope it was worth the materials. 

mining: its pretty standared, nothing special. im sure it might get better later on, but ill never find out. but within the first few levels of you mining laser, it was pretty standard. 

Organization: their teir system wasn't done well AT ALL. i only got about half way through it and i found myself getting frustrated when trying to find stuff. like they have mark1weapons and forward, and if you need a mark1weapon you can't just search "mark1weapon, you need to click on each weapon and see what kind it is, got really annoying. there are some items that are broken in this game that you can't get, but im sure they will fix it in the future but for now it makes it impossible to get any of those items. 

Dungeons: these just suck... like hard, they tried to make them a cool platform area, but they aren't they just suck and are annoying as all hell, and when you die you have to start from the beginning and fight your way back to where you were at. and if you wanted to get all the material you need from these dungeons you have to spend hours and hours in them. its just not fun. then there is another dungeon where its a boss one and its fucking impossible, i barely did any damage and died almost imediatly, and icouldn't build anything else untill i got those materials from thsi dungeon. 
(there might have been stuff that i could have built but there was no fucknig way to figure out what i needed to maybe beat him, the organizaion of items in this game are fucking BAD. there might have been items to help me, but damned if i could find them.)

all in all this game still has a long way to go and if you don't mind dealing with a game that has alot of work ahead of it, then have fun, but i for one stopped having funa round the 10hour mark and was just hoping it would get less frustrating, and it didn't 20 hours in and im done, im just interested in anything else this game has to offer, it seems like the further i go the more problems there are. they need to stop adding things to this game and fix the problems at hand.

column8:
The concept is good but the game itself is bad or I should say, there's not enough content and there's many flaws, the random generated levels system is weak, each time I'm creating a new World, it feels like the same previous World, again and again.
There's few weapons, few armors, few creatures, few of absolutely everything you can name.
There's just not enough content.
I would not suggest you to buy this game especially since the developer has probably left it to rot.
You should get Terraria, Crea, Signs of Life or even Starbound if you don't have already have those/one of those but stay away from this one, It is not worth it, It wouldn't even be worth 3$ Believe me.
And even if it goes on sale for 1$ Do not buy it, do not give that guy money he doesn't deserve.

3/10 The concept is good but the content is too weak and there are many flaws, not worth it.

column8:
EDIT: How is this still available for sale? It's a broken scam! Do not buy!

This is less of a review and more of a warning because the game is broken and unfinished. If you can deal with game breaking bugs for multiplayer and game hindering bugs in single player then by all means purchase this to get a taste of what a great game it could have been if it was finished.

I was a part of the Early Access players that enjoyed Lady Ajew (or whatever her name was) performing damage control for erroneous coding (not to be confused with erogenous) and a poorly timed "Full Release" which was thrown upon us a proclamation that it was neccessary to release it as full to iron out all the bugs; of which there were countless! (I'm sure the Early Access period was the time to do this, but as Lady Ajew the damage controller stated; it was the perfect time for a Full Release!?)

I feel that if you buy this title you'll yearn for updates to address issues with mountains of bugs, misinforming dialogue and higilty pigilty coding of both the game and the GUI.

This game could have been fun but is just far too busted to be fully enjoyed; it's just unfinished and broken.

If you try this game and want it to be complete it may hurt your soul, even if just that tiny little bit.

column8:
I played this game for a bit solo, got a few hours in, and then wanted to play multiplayer with a friend. So I created a new character with the same name as my old one and without so much as an "Are you sure you want to do that?" my old character was instantly wiped from existence.

Then I found out that you have a different set of characters for single and multiplayer, so I couldn't even use the bastard that had ruthlessly murdered his predecessor.

Not a great first impression.

Extremely buggy, crashes often, lots of multiplayer glitches and gaffs, progression is very grindy. Artwork is kind of ugly, crafting receipes don't make sense (craft guns and high-tech looking workbenches out of dirt, mud, clay, and stone?) Inventory management is awkward as hell, controls are awful (Tab is both reload and switch between layers, but isn't mentioned in tutorial? Background bricks can't be mind unless they're borders, but ore generates in the bckground, ensuring that you'll always leave some behind? Double-press X to pick up furniture?)

Overall, a prime example of a game that SHOULDN'T BE AVAILABLE YET. This is exactly what's wrong with early access.

Maybe one day it will be good. Right now, your $15 would be much better spent on Terraria or Starbound.
